unwrap3D.Tracking.tracking module

Created on Fri Jul 15 16:50:05 2022

@author: felix

unwrap3D.Tracking.tracking.Eval_dense_optic_flow(prev, present, params)[source]

Computes the optical flow using Farnebacks Method

Parameters
prevnumpy array

previous frame, m x n image

presentnumpy array

current frame, m x n image

paramsPython dict

a dict object to pass all algorithm parameters. Fields are the same as that in the opencv documentation, https://docs.opencv.org/2.4/modules/video/doc/motion_analysis_and_object_tracking.html. Our recommended starting values:

  • params[‘pyr_scale’] = 0.5

  • params[‘levels’] = 3

  • params[‘winsize’] = 15

  • params[‘iterations’] = 3

  • params[‘poly_n’] = 5

  • params[‘poly_sigma’] = 1.2

  • params[‘flags’] = 0

Returns
flowfinds the displacement field between frames, prev and present such that \(\mathrm{prev}(y,x) = \mathrm{next}(y+\mathrm{flow}(y,x)[1], x+\mathrm{flow}(y,x)[0])\) where (x,y) is the cartesian coordinates of the image.

unwrap3D.Tracking.tracking.get_iou(bb1, bb2)[source]

Calculate the Intersection over Union (IoU) of two bounding boxes.

Parameters
bb1dict

Keys: {‘x1’, ‘x2’, ‘y1’, ‘y2’} The (x1, y1) position is at the top left corner, the (x2, y2) position is at the bottom right corner

bb2dict

Keys: {‘x1’, ‘x2’, ‘y1’, ‘y2’} The (x, y) position is at the top left corner, the (x2, y2) position is at the bottom right corner

Returns
float

in [0, 1]
